abstract: Performs the multiply operation *Y = alpha * AX* on a sparse matrix of single-precision, floating-point values.

declaration.code: func SparseMultiply(_ alpha: Float, _ A: SparseMatrix_Float, _ X: DenseMatrix_Float, _ Y: DenseMatrix_Float)

overview:
## Discussion

Use this function to multiply a scalar value by a sparse matrix, and then by a dense matrix. The following equation is an example of a scalar-matrix-matrix multiplication where the first matrix is sparse:



Call [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/SparseMultiply(_:_:_:_:)-73ruq]to calculate the result.

items.description: Performs the multiply operation *Y* *= AX* on a sparse matrix of double-precision, floating-point values.
items.name: SparseMultiply(_:_:_:)

items.description: Performs the multiply operation *Y* *= AX*_ _on a sparse matrix of single-precision, floating-point values.
items.name: SparseMultiply(_:_:_:)

items.description: Performs the multiply operation *Y = alpha * AX* on a sparse matrix of double-precision, floating-point values.
items.name: SparseMultiply(_:_:_:_:)
